docs.snippet: The Kansas City Royals entered September clinging to first place in the A.L. Central and aiming for their first playoff spot since they won it all in 1985. Will their patience finally be rewarded?...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Kansas City Royals entered September clinging to first place in the A.L. Central and aiming for their first playoff spot since they won it all in 1985. Will their patience finally be rewarded?
docs.abstract: Kansas City Royals enter September clinging to first place in the American League Central and aiming for their first playoff berth since their World Series victory in 1985; Royals fans, long accustomed to disappointment, wonder whether their patience will finally be rewarded with a renaissance.

headline.main: Loyal to the Royals, Hoping for a Renaissance
headline.print_headline: Daring to Hope in Kansas City

docs.snippet: Doubles players treat points as baseball or football players might, mapping out tactics in advance and using the between-point encounters to prop each other up....
docs.lead_paragraph: Doubles players treat points as baseball or football players might, mapping out tactics in advance and using the between-point encounters to prop each other up.
docs.abstract: Conversations between partners in doubles tennis are essential, even if they are often too long for spectators; players at United States Open explain that their discussions are similar to breaks in other sports and are used to map out tactics, such as where to serve; teams also use their brief encounters to support each other and get through difficult periods in the match.

headline.main: All That Back and Forth at the U.S. Open, Between Doubles Partners
headline.print_headline: All That Back and Forth at the Open, Between Doubles Partners
